data.title: [Wiki] Code Editor's Display Settings Linux File preference location
data.body:
Can you please specify location of the preference file for Linux on page 
[https://github.com/AtomicGameEngine/AtomicGameEngine/wiki/Changing-the-Code-Editor's-Display-Settings](https://github.com/AtomicGameEngine/AtomicGameEngine/wiki/Changing-the-Code-Editor's-Display-Settings) ?
~/.local/share/AtomicEditor/Preferences/prefs.json

data.title: Add Spin control to Animation Toolbar
data.body: This PR adds a control in the Animation Toolbar to spin the previewed model. Though you can use the Inspector to rotate the model, who's got time for that? The control is a Slider, the leftmost position is off, there are 10 steps, the further right the slider is pushed, the faster the spin. Bonus, This feature also works while animations are playing.

data.title: Real time theme switching in editor
data.body:
Allows switching of light and dark editor and code editor themes using an entries in the Developer menu, Toggle Theme and Toggle Code Editor Theme.
This changes happen in real time, and are saved in the preferences to the last setting you've selected, so it will come back in that theme.
  There are some minor artifacts when switching between the editor themes, a couple of borders and hilights are not changed for Turbobadger reasons and these return to normal on the next editor invocation. Since swapping themes is probably going to be a infrequent operation, it is tolerable.

data.title: [Events] Expose Player IPC event handlers to editor
Programmatically jump to line in editor
data.body:
This PR wires up the JSResourceEditor::JumpToLineNumber and JumpToToken methods so that the editor can programmatically jump to a line number.  It additionally does the following:
- Can request to load an editor tab passing a file path and also a line number and it will either load up a new editor and jump to the line or switch to it if it was previously loaded and jump to the line
- work on the TypeScript compiler so that the compile results window that pops up is non-modal and magnifying glass icons appear next to each error.  Clicking the magnifying glass will load that file and jump to the line number

@JoshEngebretson At one point, wasn't there an "Errors" or "Issues" tab in the editor?  Do you think it would be a good idea to bring something like that back and then expose an API to be able to populate it with bookmarks to editor locations?  Bookmarks could be user set bookmarks, or a TODO parser that populates it, or the TS Compiler errors, or even a log scanner that scans the player log for errors?  If so, maybe that could be a followup issue?

data.title: Updating examples submodule
Register variant map xml name as significant at load time
Fix event handler to use the native wrapper.
data.body: The merge pulled out the EditorEvents file that this relied on.

data.title: Add a significant string registry for StringHash, use string instead of hash for variant map XML keys when possible
data.body:
This PR makes script component field values more pleasant in XML, uses field name instead of hash value, resave scene to switch to field names, names and hashes are supported for backwards compatibility.

Closes #1431

data.title: [Events] Support multiple subscribers with subscribeToEvent
data.body:
Currently it appears that when using ```subscribeToEvent```, it's only possible to have a single subscriber for each event type associated with a AObject.  

This would be more useful if you could have multiple subscribers to an event.  Right now, if you subscribe to an event on an object that already has an existing subscriber, it discards the previous subscription and replaces it with the new one instead of keeping both and then triggering the callback on both when a ```sendEvent``` is fired.

data.title: User and Application settings improvements
data.body:
This PR enhances the way settings are handled
- Editor level settings can be retrieved and set from editor extensions
- When settings are updated, any open web views will auto-reconfigure the code editor window with any updates.  This allows for changing the code theme on the fly

data.title: Update to Monaco Editor 0.8.1.  Fixes #1392
Toggle editor themes
data.body:
Allows switching of light and dark editor themes, using an entry in the Developer menu, Toggle Theme.
This change happens in real time, and is saved in the preferences to the last setting you've selected, so it will come back in that theme.
It handles 99% of the user interface, there are some minor artifacts when switching between the themes, a couple of borders and hilights are not changed for Turbobadger reasons and these return to normal on the next editor invocation. Since swapping themes is probably going to be a infrequent operation, it is tolerable.
The codeEditor theme is not changed, and needs some work in order to also change it on the fly.

data.title: 1393 - Update editor to use new event signatures
data.body:
This PR ended up being quite a bit larger than I anticipated, but I think it really cleans things up. 

 fixes #1424 
 fixes #1393 

 The following were changed:

- All of the calls to ```subscribeToEvent``` were updated to use the new signature:
```
subscribeToEvent(Atomic.UIWidgetEvent((e)=>{ ... }));
unsubscribeFromEvent(Atomic.UIWidgetEventType);
```
- ```sendEvent``` was updated to accept a meta data object like ```subscribeToEvent``` and updated to use the new signature:
```
sendEvent(Atomic.UIWidgetEventData({ data object }));
```
- New method ```Atomic.scriptEventData``` was created for user defined events
- All editor events defined in ```EditorEvents.ts``` were migrated to native code so that they could be manipulated with the new declarative event handling.
- Identified events that were not being referenced anywhere and removed them
  - E_FINDTEXT
  - E_FINDTEXTCLOSE
  - E_FINDTEXTOPEN
  - E_JAVASCRIPTSAVED
  - E_EDITORPLAYSTOP (E_EDITORPLAYERSTOPPED is used insted)
  - E_PLAYERERROR
  - E_CONSOLEMESSAGE
  - E_PLATFORMCHANGE
  - E_CURLCOMPLETE
  - E_EDITORSHUTDOWN
  - E_RESOURCEEDITORCHANGED

- Modified the JS parsing to extract out comments from ```ATOMIC_EVENT``` and ```ATOMIC_PARM``` calls so that they can be emitted into the ```.d.ts``` file and picked up by TSDoc
  - comment needs to be a single line comment on the line above the ```ATOMIC_EVENT``` or after the param type on the ```ATOMIC_PARM```
- Added some documentation to the events...more needed though.
- Cleaned up events that were not sending the right params or were sending params when there were none identified for that event
- Removed the old style ENUMS from the ```d.ts```.  They are still in the engine so existing JS doesn't break, but TS will display errors until the usage is mapped to the new enums
- Updated all enum references in the editor to use the new style enums

data.title: [C#] Change CSComponent's FieldValues to use the field name instead of the hash of that name
data.body:
Currently the fieldvalues in CSComponent use the hash of a field's name to identify the field. This makes it much harder to work directly within the scene or prefab text when not working in the editor. This it also relevant when doing diffs between scenes or prefabs and trying to make sense of those changes. 

This should be made backwards compatible by supporting _reading_ hashes or names, but _always writing_ names.

data.title: Created a case for UInt types when setting values on CSComponents
data.body:
Hi @JoshEngebretson 

i added a case for uints when setting values to fields on a CSComponent. 

- Raheel

data.title: [Script] Generate getter properties for "Is" methods

milestone.title: Issue Staging
milestone.description: A staging area for milestones, while we work through the backlog

data.body:
There are inconsistencies with Is/Get method names for C++ getter methods, for example:

https://github.com/AtomicGameEngine/AtomicGameEngine/blob/498e42fcc2ec8f6dbc1a3a78ea0345c1d3931b0d/Source/Atomic/Graphics/ParticleEmitter.h#L97

These shouldn't be renamed to "Get", though the binding tech should know to treat them as property getters in JS/TS/C#

data.title: [Editor] Text clipping in examples / editor UI improvement
data.body:
Verified on Windows 7, latest build and master.

Text in examples listing are clipped on the 3rd line. A quick fix is to increase the height of the text area a little bit. Ideally make it somewhat responsive, including horizontally because the 3-item columns look ugly on large windows (but I don't know if this latter was reported elsewhere).

![clipping](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8399299/22409600/cfd4de0c-e66a-11e6-8e5f-82797ab89864.PNG)

data.title: Fix for #1425
data.body: @JoshEngebretson, This fixes the issue with the Atom editor displaying the "js outdated" error described on the forums.

data.title: [TS Extension] Set "allowJs" to false when creating the external tsconfig.json
data.body:
The setting inside the tsconfig.json for trying to recompile external javascript files should be set to false.  This is an advanced feature and not necessary in most TypeScript projects.

Need to set:
```
"allowJs": false
```
in the generated tsconfig.

data.title: [Editor] Migrate all the editor internal events to the new event system
data.body: Convert all the events used inside the editor to use the new Atomic Native and Atomic Script events.

data.title: [Linux] Super/Control key detection wrong

milestone.title: Issue Staging
milestone.description: A staging area for milestones, while we work through the backlog

data.body: There are a couple of instances of detecting when the super key on OSX and the Alt Key on Windows is pressed. When compiling for linux, the OSX methodology is being used, it needs to follow the windows way, since linux uses a standard keyboard.

data.title: Atomic Script Events
data.body: This PR resolved #1302 allowing for a more standard way of defining script events to align with the Native events.  Thanks for the assistance @JoshEngebretson!

data.title: [Editor] Camera continues to move in scene when holding RMB
data.body:
This happens on Windows only.

To replicate:
* Use RMB to look around the scene
* Stop moving the mouse while continuing to hold RMB

data.title: Fix ScriptEvent for 1302
data.body:
This is a fix for the in progress #1302 branch

The parameter count for the native method was incorrect, so the method was never getting called.  

It is possible to debug this with the AtomicEditor by passing the --player option, specifying a project, and placing a break point in the method.  

AtomicEditor --player --project /Users/josh/Documents/AtomicProjects/MyProject

If you want variable arguments to a native function btw, specify DUK_VARARGS (then you need to check the stack top for how many args are passed in).  

I also removed the push of the current function at the top of the method.

The code paste now runs! 👍  😄

data.title: [Editor] Allow project assets to be duplicated.
data.body:
Much like the duplicate option in the Hierarchy panel, have the same type service in the Project panes for your other assets. You have to go out to the OS to do this presently.
There should be an auto-naming function for the duplicated item, to avoid name clashes. They can be renamed if the auto-name is not acceptable.
Duplicated files should be made in the same folder as the original (if there are write permissions to do so).
